name: OLL Edges: Dot
description: Use when: No top-layer edges have yellow facing up -- you see only a yellow center dot. This is the worst edge case. Apply this to go directly to a yellow cross. Hold the cube in any orientation.
algorithm: F R U R' U' F' f R U R' U' f'
setupMoves: f U R U' R' f' F U R U' R' F'

steps.label: F R U R' U' F': Flip two yellow edge stickers to face up — after this, the four yellow edges go from a dot (no yellow showing) to an L-shape (two adjacent yellow edges facing up, forming a backward-L at back-left)
f R U R' U' f': Flip the remaining two yellow edges — the wide f move uses the middle slice to reach the two edges that still have yellow facing sideways, turning the L-shape into a full yellow cross

name: OLL Edges: L-Shape
description: Use when: Exactly two adjacent edges have yellow on top, forming an L-shape (like a backward L in the back-left). Hold the cube so the two yellow edges point to the LEFT and BACK (9 o'clock position). Then apply this to get a full yellow cross.
algorithm: F R U R' U' F'
setupMoves: F U R U' R' F'

steps.label: F: Open the front face — this exposes the front and top edge stickers so they can be cycled
R U R': Cycle three top-layer edges — the two edges that had yellow facing sideways (front and right) get flipped so their yellow stickers now face up
U': Rotate the top layer back to realign the edges with their side colors
F': Close the front face — all four yellow edge stickers now face up, forming a complete yellow cross

name: OLL Edges: Line
description: Use when: Exactly two opposite edges have yellow on top, forming a straight line. Hold the cube so the line runs LEFT to RIGHT (horizontal). Then apply this to get a full yellow cross.
algorithm: f R U R' U' f'
setupMoves: f U R U' R' f'

steps.label: f: Wide front move (front + middle slice together) — this reaches the two opposite edges that have yellow facing sideways by also engaging the middle layer
R U R': Cycle the edges — the middle-slice involvement means the front and back edges (which have yellow facing the sides) get flipped so yellow now faces up
U': Rotate the top back to realign edge positions
f': Close the wide front — all four yellow edge stickers now face up, completing the yellow cross

name: OLL Corners: Sune
description: Use when: You have a yellow cross on top and exactly ONE corner has yellow on top. Hold the cube so the solved corner is in the FRONT-LEFT position. The classic 'Sune' algorithm orients the other three corners.
algorithm: R U R' U R U2 R'
setupMoves: R U2 R' U' R U' R'

steps.label: R U R': Lift the right layer and twist — this takes the front-right corner (which has yellow facing the front, not up) and rotates it so its yellow sticker moves toward the top face
U: Rotate the top layer to bring the next unoriented corner (back-right, with yellow facing the right side) into the front-right working position
R U2 R': Double-turn twist — this orients the remaining two corners (the one just brought in and the back-left corner) so all their yellow stickers now face up, completing the full yellow face

name: OLL Corners: Anti-Sune
description: Use when: You have a yellow cross and exactly ONE corner has yellow on top, but the surrounding pattern is the mirror of Sune. Hold the solved corner in the FRONT-RIGHT. This is the reverse of Sune.
algorithm: R U2 R' U' R U' R'
setupMoves: R U R' U R U2 R'

steps.label: R U2 R': Double-turn lift — takes the front-right corner (which has yellow facing the right side) and twists it so yellow begins rotating toward the top face
U': Rotate the top layer to bring the next unoriented corner into the front-right working position
R U' R': Twist and lower — orients the remaining corners so all their yellow stickers now face up, completing the full yellow face

name: OLL Corners: Headlights
description: Use when: You have a yellow cross and exactly TWO corners oriented, and they're on the SAME SIDE (adjacent). Hold the cube so the two solved corners are at the BACK. This fixes the front two corners.
algorithm: R2 D R' U2 R D' R' U2 R'
setupMoves: R U2 R D R' U2 R D' R2

steps.label: R2: Rotate the right layer 180° — this moves the two front corners (which have yellow facing sideways) into a position where they can be twisted through the bottom layer
D R': Send one corner through the bottom layer — the yellow sticker on this corner begins rotating from the side toward the top face
U2: Double-turn the top layer — this twist reorients the corner's yellow sticker so it now faces upward
R D': Bring the corner back up through the bottom and repeat the bottom-layer trick for the second front corner
U2: Second double-turn — orients the second corner so its yellow sticker also faces up
R': Restore the right layer — both front corners now have yellow facing up, matching the two back corners that were already solved

name: OLL Corners: Chameleon
description: Use when: You have a yellow cross and exactly TWO corners oriented, but they're on DIAGONAL opposites (not the same side). Any holding angle works since the pattern is symmetrical.
algorithm: r U R' U' r' F R F'
setupMoves: F R' F' r U R U' r'

steps.label: r U R': Wide move + twist — the wide r move takes the middle slice along with the right layer, which lets it reach the front-right corner. The corner's yellow sticker (currently facing the front) gets twisted toward the top face
U': Rotate top back to realign — prepares the diagonally opposite corner (back-left, with yellow also facing sideways) for the next step
r' F R F': Sledgehammer move — twists the back-left corner so its yellow sticker rotates from the side to face up. Both diagonal corners now have yellow on top, completing the full yellow face

name: OLL Corners: Bowtie
description: Use when: You have a yellow cross but NO corners have yellow on top (all four corners are twisted). Apply Sune once -- this will give you a one-corner case, then apply Sune or Anti-Sune again to finish.
algorithm: R U R' U R U' R' U R U2 R'
setupMoves: R U2 R' U' R U R' U' R U' R'

steps.label: R U R' U R U' R' U R U2 R' (first 7): This is the Sune algorithm — all four corners have yellow facing sideways (none face up). Sune twists three of the four corners so their yellow stickers rotate to face upward, leaving exactly one corner still unoriented

R U2 R' (last 4): Now with only one corner left unsolved, this second pass twists the final corner so its yellow sticker faces up — completing the entire yellow face (all 9 yellow stickers visible on top)
